div.a: NOW HIRING - Science Teacher - IMPACT Academy

span.p: The following position is available for the 2020-2021 school year:

ul.li: Candidate must possess appropriate Ohio licensure in grades 7-12
Preference given to candidates with STEM Education Experience
NE Ohio IMPACT Academy position, employee of Campbell City Schools

span.p: Interested and qualified individuals should submit a letter of interest and resume to Mr. Matthew Bowen, Superintendent at mbowen@campbell.k12.oh.us AND Carol Michaels, Administrative Assistant cmmichaels@campbell.k12.oh.us no later than 3:00 pm on Thursday, April 23, 2020.

Campbell Elementary students and teachers are doing a fantastic job working and communicating during this unique time! Please email any pictures of our kids working at home to
jgoske@campbell.k12.oh.us.
Let’s see how everyone is keeping up with schoolwork!
We miss these smiling faces!

a.title: Click to read more about: Students Working from Home

div.a: Read More about Students Working from Home

span.p:
Students,
Submit a picture of a severe weather poster you create and we will post the winners on our FB and website on Friday, March 27th. The top three selections will receive a $25.00 gift card.
Email: Mbowen@campbell.k12.oh.us
In the subject line: Tornado Name Grade

Parents,
PLEASE take the time to review Tornado and Severe Weather procedures with your family. NOW is the time to review.
Next week is Ohio’s Severe Weather Awareness Week, March 22-28 and the Statewide Tornado Drill is Wednesday, March 25 at 9:50 am (We believe it is still scheduled and has not been canceled)
Please review the two links below:
https://weathersafety.ohio.gov/
https://weathersafety.ohio.gov/Documents/Brochures/EMA0004_Protection_Against_Tornadoes.pdf

span.p:
Taking Temperatures Upon Entry
Please know we are making every effort to keep our staff safe and well. Please cooperate ￼if there is a need to enter the building. You will be required to have your temperature taken and confidential health screening completed.
We must continue to provide nutrition and remote learning opportunities for our children. We thank you in advance for your cooperation. The health of our staff is critical to maintaining operations for the children we serve.

span.p:
A huge thank you to Mrs. Strohecker for the Red Devil Readers YouTube channel! If your child would like to submit a video of them doing a read aloud, email it to reddevilreaders@gmail.com. Parents and staff members are also welcome to submit - help us build something great for our kids!
We can’t wait to see who shows up to read!

p.span:
Building hours will be adjusted March 18th and 19th to help accommodate anyone who was not able to pick up an academic packet.
The building will be open both days from 8:30 am until 6:00 pm.
Please enter the front doors to pick up your packets. If you are still unable to pick up a packet please visit the district website. All packets are saved on the website as PDF files.

br.br:
8:30 am to 6:00 pm
Thursday, March 19th
8:30 am to 6:00 pm

span.strong:
Packets can be found on our website at:

br.strong: Click to listen to Mr. Klingensmith's All Call Message

a.title: Click to read more about: PK-6 Update - March 17, 2020

div.a: Read More about PK-6 Update - March 17, 2020

span.p: All school extra curricular activities and practices have been postponed until further notice. In the meantime, our teachers have worked hard to ensure our students’ learning will continue. Teachers have planned a blended curriculum with options of paper/pencil and computer based assignments. It is highly encouraged that all of our students check their school emails regularly. If a student does not have access to the internet or a computer, hard copies will be available for pick up at Memorial High School. If you need hard copies of your work, students or parents will be able to pick up their instructional materials outside of the main entrance of the high school. Instructional materials will be available on Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday from 9AM-12PM. To ensure social distancing, we will not permit any student or parent to enter the building.

At anytime a student or parent has a question please do not hesitate to email or call your teachers. Our teachers will return your email/call as soon as possible. Mr. Yeager will also be available via email or voicemail at all times. Please call 330.799.1515 to leave a voicemail for Mr. Yeager.

Please utilize the Campbell City Schools website and Facebook page regularly for more important information. Links for student work will be housed on the school’s website. The teachers and administration at Memorial High School appreciate your cooperation through these adverse times. Please stay safe and healthy and we look forward to seeing you all soon.

a.title: Click to read more about: Memorial High School Update

div.a: Read More about Memorial High School Update

span.p:
FOOD SERVICES
To continually do what is best for students, free meal packs will be provided to Campbell City School students under the age of 18 on Tuesdays and Fridays, starting on March 17, 2020. These meal packs will be available at four locations throughout the City of Campbell. These locations are Christ Community Church, Shiloh Baptist Church, Neighborhood Ministries, and Campbell Elementary School between the hours of 10AM to 11:30AM. Meal packs will include multi-day breakfasts and lunches. This endeavor is new so please be patient and respectful as we work out the kinks to distribute these free meals. Please know Campbell City Police will be present to assist in maintaining order, and we hope all practice social distancing. Academic packets for K-6 and IMPACT students will be available at any of the locations.

a.title: Click to read more about: Food Services - Food Pickup

div.a: Read More about Food Services - Food Pickup

span.p: Dear Students, Parents and Community Members,

After consultation with the Ohio Department of Health, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has at this point ordered K-12 Schools to close at the end of the day, Monday, March 16th. Students in the Campbell City School District will NOT report on March 16, 2020. Classes will resume April 6, 2020 as we have been directed, but please understand we are prepared to extend remote learning opportunities if the date to return to school were to change. This is a rapidly evolving situation and one that is being monitored closely. We will responsibly follow directives from the Governor’s Office, Ohio Department of Health and Department of Education.

The following listed recommendations will be effective immediately:
*All out-of-state field trips are canceled until further notice.
*All field trips are canceled until further notice.
*All indoor student performances and mass *gatherings open to the public will be postponed until further notice.
*Additional guidance from Ohio High School Athletic Association will be monitored.
*Schools will prepare for remote learning as necessary.
*All extra-curricular practices, on and off school grounds are suspended until further notice.

p.strong: Click Read More for the full notification

a.title: Click to read more about: Please Read: Important Message

div.a: Read More about Please Read: Important Message

span.p: Please watch the message from the State Superintendent. We have already begun planning for our students.
Responsibly, the governor did close schools for three weeks beginning at the close of day on Monday, March 16.

Students in the Campbell City Schools will not report on Monday, March 16th and please watch for future announcements concerning remote learning expectations, information regarding those with disabilities and access to nutrition.￼￼

With great challenges emerge incredible compassion, caring acts and displays of love for each other. Campbell is a strong community and we know together we will we do what is right for our children and families.￼￼

We are proud to serve!￼
￼￼￼￼

a.title: Click to read more about: Message from the State Superintendent

div.a: Read More about Message from the State Superintendent
Innovative Campbell schools center started with a discussion

span.p: Student voice matters. We thank the graduates of 2016 for their courageous conversations during Civics Day. We listened and have been happy to work hard to create future opportunities for future generations. Additional appreciation to the many partners, state and local leadership embracing the opportunity to serve and grow our regional economy through collaborative services, innovative education and family wellness.

a.title: Click to read more about: Innovative Campbell schools center started with a discussion

div.a: Read More about Innovative Campbell schools center started with a discussion

span.p:
The students did an amazing job and we are so proud of them. Their incredible solos were beautifully performed.
We are fortunate to have growing support for the fine and performing arts in our Campbell community. Thank you to all those who continue to support the students and the arts!
Students, feel free to reach out if you would like us to post your video on social media. If we have them saved we will do our best to honor your request.

a.title: Click to read more about: March Music Madness

div.a: Read More about March Music Madness

span.p: Campbell Memorial would like to congratulate proud Red Devil Michael Vaschak (Class of 72’) and his family. Michael will be inducted into the OHSAA Officials Hall of Fame (posthumously) on June 20, 2020 in Columbus. Michael served as a teacher in Campbell City Schools for 37 years before his retirement in 2015. This Hall of Fame honor is bestowed upon him following a decorated officiating career that included working ten boys and seven girls state basketball championship basketball games as well as a state title game and three semifinal contests in football. Michael was looked upon as a mentor to young officials in the field and a consummate professional by his peers. While rising to become one of the top officials in the state he was highly respected by coaches, student-athletes and school administrators. The Campbell City Schools was, is, and will always be proud to call Mikey Vaschak a Red Devil!

a.title: Click to read more about: Michael Vaschak - OHSAA Officials HOF

div.a: Read More about Michael Vaschak - OHSAA Officials HOF
PAID TRAINING OPPORTUNITY - EARN WHILE YOU LEARN!!!!

span.p: The following classified position is available for the 2019-2020 school year:

li.strong: Work as substitute van driver during CDL and bus driver training; receive compensation for bus driver training
Current BCI and FBI background checks
Satisfactory results of pre-employment drug screening as well as ongoing random drug/alcohol screenings
Also accepting applications from individuals with a current CDL with Bus Endorsement and current Bus Driver Training Certificate from State of Ohio

span.p: Salary per negotiated agreement.

Interested and qualified individuals should submit a letter of interest and resume to Superintendent Matthew L. Bowen, 280 Sixth Street, Campbell, OH 44405 OR electronically at cmmichaels@campbell.k12.oh.us (superintendent’s secretary). Applications will be accepted until position is filled.

EARN HIGH SCHOOL and COLLEGE CREDIT AT THE SAME TIME!
Memorial High School is proud to announce partnerships with THREE colleges and universities:
Stark State College
Youngstown State University
Eastern Gateway Community College
